Reviews.Title: Excellent, High Quality Camera for the Price with One Exception
Reviews.Author: Daddy Bear
Reviews.Content: Just got this brand new camera.  I replaced our Casio, which was one of the most impressive digital cameras I have ever owned (had it for only 14 months).  The reason for the replacement, my family loses cameras... a lot.. and this one went bye bye somewhere.  The Casio had great features, a nice touch screen, a great zoom, good shutter speed for sporting events, and time between photos was great for the photo quality.  It had one flaw, its inability to take night photos and the movies even in natural light were only okay.  There were a ton of options, which for a standard user could be overwhelming.Now to the PowerShot.  This camera, sometimes will look grainy on the viewfinder until the actual photo itself is taken, but when the photo is taken... perfection.  No matter the differences in light and shadows in a picture, the PowerShot somehow nicely accommodates for this.  While the standard zoom is 4X, it can go to 10x, and with the shutter and flash, it still takes much better than most from beyond its standard range.  PIctures at night with or without flash is absolutely incredible and movies are easy to take and upload.  The features are plenty, but not overly complex.  This means a standard user cannot get into trouble, but the highly discerning user might want more.  There are other 10 and 12 MP cameras out there, and many have poor picture quality, which for me makes no sense... having a high quality image of a bad shot is an oxymoron.  You don't have to worry with this camera.Here is the one downside... time between shots.  If you are looking for a camera to hold down the shutter and take pictures in multiples in rapid fire, this might not be the camera for you.  While a faster memory card will help issue, you will not be able to rattle off 5 shots in 10 seconds during your kid's soccer game.  If you want to have 2 or 3 perfect shots in that 10 seconds, this is the camera for you.  It doesn't have a touch screen either, but with the Casio, this sometimes got in the way during viewing or taking shots.Summarizing... This camera is easy to use, not confusing, has a great smart mode, and has yet to take a poor picture in any light condition.  If you can't take a good picture on your current camera, you will be able to on this one.  The movie mode is very easy, but should be used in good light either indoors or out.  It does zoom during the movie, which I understand isn't common, and the microphone is extremely sensitive... which means if you fumble around, it will record the fumbling noise, but that is very hard to avoid on any camera.  It is lightweight, but substantial enough to hold comfortably.  All in all, this is a camera any family would be happy to have.

Reviews.Title: Extremely easy to use. Packed with a range of clever and user-friendly features.
Reviews.Author: Surgery100 "ADJ"
Reviews.Content: This is a compact, easy-to-use, bring the fun back to photography camera that provides Canon's photo quality in a lower cost, compact build. A little bit bigger than the digital elphs, this camera still fits comfortably in a shirt or pant pocket.The feature set is very basic, and nothing new. It has a "Face select" feature which lets you select which person you want to focus on in a group. On the dial it has four settings: Auto, Easy, Program and movie modes. The auto mode is just as with every other camera, the camera will select the settings it determines best, but you maintain control (if you care to select it) over the white balance and flash. Easy is the same as auto, except no options. Program gives you the option to select among several "scenes": Portrait, Landscape, Night, Kids&Pets;, and Indoor (buried in the menu you can also select lesser used scene settings like Beach, Long Shutter, and Fireworks).The only negative I've encountered with the camera is the relatively slow processor. That is the power up time (the time between turning the camera on and taking the first picture) is average (about 2 seconds), however, the time between pictures is around 2 seconds without the flash to 4 seconds with the flash. If you envision having (or wanting) to take faster pictures, then this is not the camera for you. Similarly, if you want to have any control over settings (i.e. shutter speed if you want to take pictures of your running toddler) this is not the camera for you.Bottom line:Canon replaces control and feature selection for extreme ease-of-use. This camera is a solid option for the money, and in case you are considering the A3000 IS, this (the A3100) is well worth the extra $30 (better resolution and faster picture-to-picture time).The picture quality is great, no blur and vivid colors.

Reviews.Title: Astounding little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Gordon M. Wagner
Reviews.Content: My Canon S410 Powershot gave up the ghost, even after a trip back to Canon for repairs ($100, ouch). I was tired of not having a camera and this one crossed my path at the right time and I bought it after debating for months which camera to go with.This is MUCH lighter than my Canon S410, and far sleeker -- all the knobs and buttons and whatnot are smooth and out of the way. It won't snag on things like the boxy S410 tended to do. This camera is as light as a plastic disposable camera. I remember my first digital camera back in 1999 which weighed a pound and then some.The LCD screen is ENORMOUS compared to my old camera(s). It takes up almost the entire back of the camera body. Amazing. The controls are scrunched together compared to the S410 controls. Having had the S410 I was familiar with the Canon layout and the way the camera works, which was nice.An earlier review mentioned that the startup time and the time between shots was long -- I didn't find that to be the case. It powers up almost instantly, and even taking photos at the largest image size the time between shots is only a second or two. My first digital camera would tend to "submarine" for six or seven seconds between shots!Overall I'm VERY, VERY happy to have a camera that works again, and the cost wasn't all that much, like half of what I paid five years ago for the S410. Half the cost, half the weight... I still daydream about getting a "real" camera, a digital SLR (DSLR) with a nice heavy L-series prime lens... but it wouldn't fit in my pocket, would it?Don't hesitate -- this is a beautiful little device, thoughtfully designed and nicely manufactured. If you're traveling or if you're a parent (or both) you know you simply cannot take too many photos. I bought a 4GB card for this, one of those little big-as-your-thumbnail chips, and even at the highest resolution the photos are about 2MB apiece, so you can shoot a lot of photos and never run out of space. Included with the camera was a cable to attach to a television, which I thought was a neat idea. I'll have to play with that sometime.My only caveat would be based on my experience having sent my S410 in for repair to Canon -- for $100 the repair didn't last long at all, I wonder if they just sent me a refurbished unit they had. Anyway, don't DROP your camera and you won't have to send it in to be repaired.

Reviews.Title: It accomplishes what the "A" series Canon's are supposed to....
Reviews.Author: Morphie "Morphie"
Reviews.Content: This is the third Canon "A" series that I have purchased.  For those of you unfamiliar with the Canon line, they are targeted at users who value simplicity and ease of use.  Clearly, they are also focused on a price point that is quite low.  If you are looking for greater sophistication and higher quality (both photographic and build), there are many other choices.  However, given its mission, the A3100 succeeds.First, ease of use is well thought out.  The user is presented with icons intended to be intuitive.  However, there is a safety net for those perplexed by that approach: the software provides a running, written commentary on the purpose of the available options.  The designers have attempted to make this device as palatable and non threatening as possible.Second, even for users accustomed to more sophisticated cameras, the image quality is more than satisfactory.  When purchasing a digital camera, one should not concentrate on "pixels". Digital imaging is dependent upon lens quality and the processor, in this case Canon's Digic III.  I have felt that Canon's processors were among the best, for years.  However, it is fair to say that the technology has improved to such an extent that many of the major brands are competitive with one another.My primary concern and criticism is build quality; the battery and memory card door is flimsy (another review mentioned this), as is the USB port cover.  Only time will tell if this is a problem.Another review has mentioned dark images and less than satisfactory results with the zoom.  While I have not utilized the digital zoom, yet, I find the optical zoom and image stabilization to operate quite well.This is not an advanced SLR or a Leica; nor is it intended to be.  However, within the scope of its designers' intent, it performs admirably, rewarding the user with photos above "snapshot" quality.  For approximately $150.00, it is difficult to imagine a better performer.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Siegel
Reviews.Content: The first digital camera that I ever bought was a Canon.  It was a PowerShot A80 that had 4.0mp and 3x digital zoom.  Since then, I have only purchased Canon brand digital cameras.  The only reason I stopped using that one was because of age.  So I bought the 7.0mp PowerShot SD750 Elph a few years ago.  Again, incredible camera.  I really liked that it had a lithium battery that was rechargeable.  That's one thing I look for in digital cameras.I bought this camera a few months ago when my SD750's battery couldn't seem to hold a charge (I had 2 different batteries for the camera).  So that's when I decided I needed to purchase a new one.  When I saw the A3100 IS, I was brought back to my first camera.  It also has choices for which type of mode you want to shoot in on the top of the camera.  It was a little hard to get used to again, but it's very easy to use.  The fact that it has 12.1 mp is definitely a plus.  The pictures I take are far superior to what my other cameras took.  I do wish that it had HD video, but I'm not complaining about it.  The video feature (which I used often) is great.  I really like how you can now zoom in and out while filming.  My mom's old camera (a Sony) was not able to do that.  She now owns a different camera (Nikon) but it isn't as easy to use as this one is.For anyone who is like me and just likes to take pictures and/or shoot videos, I'd highly recommend this camera to you.  It's easy to use and it's pretty compact.  Sure it's not as small as the Elph cameras, but it's also not huge.  I love the face detection feature as well.  I have to say that this is my favorite camera that I have owned so far.

Reviews.Title: Average at Best
Reviews.Author: B.E.B.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this camera as much as the 5-star reviewers. In fact, it was the high praise that made me buy it. However, it suffers from the typical problems most cameras in this price range do --slow shutter/write to disk speed and mediocre low light shooting.I shoot mostly indoors, and I was taken in by all the reviewers who said this camera does great in low light conditions. Not my experience. I keep it set to "Auto" mostly because I'm not a photographer who fiddles with all the settings, so I was banking on the auto feature to sort out poor lighting, but probably 30% of my indoor shots are blurry (I have a pretty steady hand) and/or over-exposed from the flash. And the time it takes to write an image to the disk (I use a high-end SanDisk Extreme III SD card)is aggravating. The pause is at least 3 seconds, which doesn't sound like a lot, but an eternity if you're trying to capture events quickly (without having to use the continuous fire mode).Also, I thought I wouldn't miss having a view finder to look through, but I was wrong. If you use this outside in bright light, the LCD is nearly useless. Taking a picture with the LCD in bright light is a crap-shoot guesstimate.Anyway, it's not the worst camera I've owned in this price range, but I'm still looking for the best in this price range, and I don't think this is it.

Reviews.Title: excellent all around camera
Reviews.Author: Jason Jimenez
Reviews.Content: I have to admit I am a big fan of Canon cameras. I've owned a number of them. My last camera was a very powerful Kodak easy share camera. It was a great device but it was complicated and not as easy to use as this Canon camera. I am not a professional photographer and I'd like a camera that has easy to use features and takes great shots in all sorts of environments. The Canon A3100IS is a fantastic all around camera. I think anybody who buys one will not be disappointed.  There are other cameras that may do one thing better than this Canon but overall the Canon trumps them all!Jason

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Radbadad "Former Fitness Freak"
Reviews.Content: All I needed was an excuse to upgrade from a Canon IXY 800IS.  It came when my wife accidentally drown my little Canon.  The 3100IS is an upgrade at a very reasonable price.Pros:Fast start up and shut-downComes in various colorslarger screen but still fits in pocketexcellent movie qualitypicture quality you expect from a bigger cameraCons:no viewfinder at this price pointthe battery/SD card lid seems a bit flimsy.PS. keep it out of salt water

Reviews.Title: Great design with inferior performance and/or defective detector array
Reviews.Author: Dr. Goetz K. Oertel "Goetz von Berlichingen"
Reviews.Content: This camera promised superior resolution, more flexible photography, and easier handling.  It met two of the three but failed in the most important aspect - resolution and image quality.With 9.1 MPs the A3100IS should produce superior images (monitor) and photos compared with my two older cameras with fewer pixels and no image stabilization.  Instead, the A31OOIS produces a dull and comparatively fuzzy image on the monitor that improves only slightly as one prepares to take a photo.  In both ways, the image has two to three times less resolution than the older cameras with their fewer pixels.  Further, the colors are subdued - somewhere between true color and a yellowish "black-white" image.  That represents a big step backward from earlier models and is certainly not an upgrade in any sense.Image stabilization can be nice - but it's next to useless when the image and photo are inferior to begin with.The camera offers an outstanding array of features and a superbly "human engineered" set of controls that quickly bring order to what might otherwise be an overwhelmingly large set of features and capabilities.  Alas, again, the poor imaging performance renders these features next to useless and reduces the fun of exploring their full range.  Finally, in regard to easier handling, the amazingly nice and compact size of the camera makes it easy to be ready to shoot.When my A3100IS arrived with this flaw, I returned it to Amazon for an exchange.  Alas, the second A3100IS was hardly better than the first.  That suggests a design flaw in optics or, more likely, the detector array.  In fact, it is not unusual for manufacturers to deliver arrays with widely variable quality.  Sometimes the quality is poor in a few units only, sometimes an entire production run may be flawed.  That may be what happened to Canon with this model.For the record, I returned the second A3100IS to Amazon for credit - not for exchange.  I still want this camera but will wait some months or a year until they can ship units that reliably produce the kind of experience I expect from this model - which should have rated five stars.Although design, flexibility, and ease of handling do deserve five stars, the resolution and color performance, sadly, are unacceptable and rate the minimum - one star - which is also my overall rating for this product - for now, at least.

Reviews.Title: Great, Fun little pocket camera that delivers great photos...
Reviews.Author: S. E. Miller "shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot A3100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)I purchased this Canon A3100IS 12.1 MP digital camera about a month ago.  At first I wasn't sure if this camera was for me...  it's my first Canon pocket digital camera (always carried a bigger digital camera) and I am pleasantly surprised how much fun it is taking photos with this camera.  The camera is easy to learn, fun to use & takes great photos.  Everyone loves the photos I've done so far & can't believe they came from this little camera!!  I'm not a professional photographer, I just like snapping photos of life's moments, to share with family & friends & occasionally surprise myself with how good they turn out!!  If you own a Mac you don't even need to download the photo program... just plug the camera in to your Mac, turn on the Canon and within a few minutes your photos are downloaded to iPhoto and ready to share!!  I would recommend this camera to anyone looking for a camera that is small (but still easy to handle), easy to learn & takes great photos.  I bought this from Amazon & received it in 3 days!!PS. I Love this camera case, can throw it in my bag or clip it to a belt loop, fits the camera well with space for extra SD cards, it's a  Caselogic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage.

Reviews.Title: Point and Shoot Digital Camera: Canon  PowerShot AS3100IS easy to use with good pictures
Reviews.Author: EleganzShopper "EleganzShopper"
Reviews.Content: I really like using this camera (Point and Shoot Digital Camera: Canon  PowerShot AS3100IS easy to use with good pictures taken every time.) It is light enough such that I carry it in my front shirt pocket or vest pocket. It has a processor like those in Canon's high end Digital SLR (DSLR); but this is a point and shoot camera with a large view finder easy to read; though not on bright sunny days (though the screen image is adjustable which I have not adjusted.) It has an image stabilizer which is great since I some times take pictures with just one hand. It is not too small for my large hands and long fingers; but it would be easy to use for those with small hands.  I bought spare batteries from Amazon which cost a fraction of the cost of the Canon brand batteries. I use 4GB flash Memory cards (Class 4 or Class 6) and it works fast enough for my uses.) I have not tried a faster Flash Memory Card such as a Class 10; perhaps it would work even faster. I did not notice any difference in speed by using the class 4 or class 6, Flash Memory cards. The Class 4, have been fine for myself. It has a number of different formats for taking pictures such as Portrait (it can recognize smiles too), landscapes, action (pets and kids), indoor lighting, etc., it has a video or movie setting too which works good too. The buttons are easier to use than other digital point and shoot cameras I have used. It takes excellent pictures and you can see the picture after you take it; then you can either save it or delete it. I read a lot of reviews about this camera before I purchased it. I researched the point and shoot cameras and I found this was the best one for performance, features and cost. It has a 4X Optical Zoom and then a digital zoom after that. It is 12.1 Mega Pixels. I used to use a SLR film camera and I like this one more as it is so light and easy to take with me every where I go.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures Point & Shoot Canon; easy to use.
Reviews.Author: EleganzShopper "EleganzShopper"
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed taking pictures with my Canon PowerShot A3100IS  12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom.It takes great pictures if the picture is well composed. It is a little slow for rapid picture taking; but there is a mode for that which improves the speed which everything works (listed as the setting for Kids & Pets.) The software installation works great with my Apple eMac (G4, 1.4GHz) as well as with Microsoft Windows 7 and with Kubuntu, Ubuntu, Xubuntu (Debian) Operating Systems too. It is small enough to put into my vest pocket and wear it every day to be ready to take pictures; it is light. The batteries (available on Amazon for much less than from Canon) come with a charger which is easy to use. The battery power lasts a long time; but I am not taking movies (which the camera will do) or taking pictures often.The controls are easy to use with big hands and long fingers. I can use my canon printer directly hooked up to the camera to print pictures; not needing to go through the computer.This camera uses the same processor as one of their high end SLR (single lens reflect) digital cameras. I have been positively impressed with it's performance. I used to use film SLR cameras; so I know about use of f-stops and shutter speeds as well as darkroom work to work on pictures; this camera is so much easier than using the old film cameras. You can see the results in the big screen in the back of the camera right away to save or delete it.It has a self-timer too. The telephoto works fine for my uses.  It is relatively inexpensive and I did not see any reason to procure a more expensive point and shoot model. This one has everything I wanted and more functions easy to use.I do have my camera attached to my vest; so it wont fall out onto the ground. If it is was to land on a hard surface I don't know how well it would work. I have not dropped it; so I don't know about that.I did buy extra memory chips and batteries; just to have. I have not needed the extra capacity beyond the 2GB memory; but I did find it useful to have an already charged battery to install while the discharged one recharged.

Reviews.Title: Good Product for the price
Reviews.Author: Truthinadvertising
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 80+ year old father.  He loves it.  I did my DD and this camera is rated in the top 5 according to independent laboratory testing.  For the money, I wish I had bought this one rather than my Kodak!

Reviews.Title: Nice improvement from the A1100IS
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Clear pictures, great battery life, easy to use, love the red colorCons:  None so far - have owned the camera for three weeks.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: V. Crayton
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a really old 3 MP Powershot that finally died.  The settings are very intuitive - it's much easier now to change from "Kids and Pets" to "Outdoor", for instance.  I love that the settings are all on a dial!I don't notice much shutter lag with this camera, either.  My old camera needed 7 seconds between shots (I told you it was really old!)...while this isn't as fast as a SLR camera, it's still faster than I expected it to be.I haven't done intensive study of the manual yet, so bear that in mind when I say that the action shots are still a little fuzzy.  I'm trying to catch a four-year-old, though!  If anyone has any tips on tweaking the "Kids and Pets" setting for that, please let me know.In all, I'm very pleased with this camera.  It's a fair price for what amounts to an entry-level point-and-shoot, it's really easy to use (my four-year-old even uses it!), and I would recommend it pretty highly.The only slight drawback that would make me give it 4.5 stars instead of 5 is the fuzzy action shots...but as I stated, I haven't investigated the issue much.  So it gets rounded up to a 5.

Reviews.Title: Superb compact digital camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel West
Reviews.Content: Canon have a great reputation compared to sony and panasonic and the Powershot A3100IS 12.1MP camera is a fantastic combination of small size and great optics, with good shooting modes and features. Personally I prefer larger more complex cameras like the Powershot SX10 IS for 'art photography' but for quick shooting on holiday, on the beach, while traveling around the compact A3100 IS is perfect. Images are much better than comparable cameras from Sony and Panasonic.

Reviews.Title: Easy to operate Digital Camera PowerShot A3100IS
Reviews.Author: EleganzShopper "EleganzShopper"
Reviews.Content: The PowerShot A3100 IS is just a little larger than my LG Venus Cell Phone. The A3100 is much more easy to take in focus pictures compared to the cell phone camera I had been using (Venus.) I was surprised at how well the pictures came out. The camera starts up fast with a choice of sounds and images. The computer set up on my Mac (eMac Tiger) was simple and fast. The instructions were easy to follow. I have large hands and this camera is easy to use the controls. The zoom works great. I tried various settings and everything came out well. In direct sunlight it can be hard to see what you are pointing at; but with auto focus you can zero in on the image area you want and the camera gives off two quick beeps to tell you that selected area is in focus. I have had a lot of fun with this camera. I used to use a Minolta SLR film camera and that Venus cell phone camera. The software works great for me on my Mac and Zino HD (PC.). I expect to use it on Debian GNU/Linux too; but I have not tried it yet with that operating system. The camera has a good feel. I carry it in my front vest pocket or shirt pocket; pull it out and easily take some quick pictures. I ordered another power pack and 2GB memory card. The battery charged up in one hour and a half; just as what was written in the operating manual. There is a place to screw the camera onto an tripod too (underneath.) I am really surprised that is such a fun and easy to use camera. When I turn on my camera the lens expands outward. I am happy with this camera. I don't have any negative things to write yet.Now that I have had this camera for a long time I have more to write about it. I have dropped it a few times on hard ground. This caused the zoom function to stop working till I kept taking the battery out and tapped the sides of the camera. Then it only took doing this a few times and the zoom was back to working normal. I discovered that the camera software will only work with my PC if I have less than 1000 pictures on the camera. I had more than than number of pictures and the cable would not transfer pictures as the computer said something like no camera was attached or not recognized. So I just deleted the 4000 pictures which I already had copies on my PC and then the software with the PC and camera worked fine again. So the camera seems pretty durable considering I dropped it from waist height onto the ground a few times. I have not had any other trouble with it. I use the self-timer regularly to take shots of my dog and myself. I've had this camera out in the windy rain storms and it got wet; but I did try to keep it dry. It has not had any problems with that either. I take the camera with me every where I go in my waist pack. So I've been happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: lens error
Reviews.Author: Shea M. Ramey
Reviews.Content: worked ok until the infamous "lens error" popped up... the camera turns on, cannot extend the lens, beeps at you and then dies.  I tried all of the remedies online (apparently this happens to a LOT of people and there is a class action lawsuit against Canon).  None of the remedies worked.  Looks like I need a new camera and it will NOT be a Canon.

Reviews.Title: Another great value from AMAZON!
Reviews.Author: S. Chambers
Reviews.Content: I haven't owned a Canon before.  I have had a Sony for years and loved it, but wanted a new digital with usb port for easier downloading.  At first this camera felt rather tinny and cheap compared to my older heavier camera, but the pictures are far clearer, crisper then from my Sony.  I have only had it a month, but I think I am going to just love this camera.  Very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: xxblahmuahxx
Reviews.Content: After getting my Canon elp sd1000 (great camera btw) i was in desperate need of a camera because I was in europe so of course i needed a new camera! i was on the fence of between a sony or a canon.  From the track record I had with my old canon, i picked the canon A3100 IS.  It's an amazing camera! I just basically left it on Auto and it helps me macro close up pictures or what not. after reading reviews and more about the camera, i found out there's a "poster" mode that looked pretty cool! i was disappointed that i didn't get to try that mode but i will def. put it to good use! love love this camera! i don't get what the other reviewer was talking about...having their screen being cloudy. i've had my camera for a month already and it's been fine. along with me dropping it. i love canon...so durable!

Reviews.Title: Small Camera with Great Features and Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: Tools30
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife's birthday in early August (2010).  She wanted a new point and shoot camera with a better picture and smaller size and weight than her current four year old camera.  After much research on my part, I selected the Canon Powershot A3100 IS.  All I can say is that she is thrilled.  She loves the size and weight, as well as the ease of use, but also the many available features, especially the Image Stabilization, 4X Optical Zoom, 12.1 MP, and the 2.7" LCD.She just loves it.  Her first 200 pictures have been great as well.  Very few dudes, even the ones taken in low light.  She is extremely pleased, so I can recommend this camera without any reservations.  And when she is happy, oh yeah, I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with my new PowerShot A3100IS
Reviews.Author: T. A. Yusran "Tom Cat"
Reviews.Content: It produces nice clear pictures with well balanced colors outdoor and indoor.  The camera is a little heavier, bigger and thicker than the Canon SD models, but it still fits in my jean's front pockets.  It has all the features you can find with the much more expensive SD models.  I would recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Overall comments
Reviews.Author: Marilyn
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera, very easy to work and play around with it. Thought my order was supposed to come with a 2Mhg card, but it did not come with the camera. It needs a case due to the large LCD screen, or a way to cover it. Had to go out and buy a case right away to prevent any damage to screen. Love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Canon review
Reviews.Author: xolanir
Reviews.Content: It's definately an upgrade from the camera that I was using, in terms of pictures quality, size & weight and menu options.Pros: Better pixel count and the pictures turn out crisp and clear. Nice and small, fit in pocket well and is ready to take pics on the go.Cons: Sometimes it takes too long to focus when trying to take a pic of an active subject, eg. little kids and sporting events.

Reviews.Title: A steal at $99.00, a solid buy for more
Reviews.Author: Neil J. Katz "blegs38552"
Reviews.Content: Bought this based on these reviews, and Consumers Reports review. The price was right - saw the same price in other places over Thanksgiving 2010 weekend, but as a prime member, Amazon was the best place to get it (not to mention has the Chase Visa card and getting the triple points).Bought this for my wife, who prefers simplicity to full featured content. For her purposes, this camera has everything that it should. Set everything to Auto and the pictures will be fine. If she wants to get creative, the facility is there for that as well.Amazon was including a memory card for free with the purchase, which took out one user's objections. Only thing that I needed to buy was a carrying case, which I picked up locally (6th Ave electronics always has a god selection of these).Anyone looking for a simple point and shoot camera needs to look no further - one hint - price seems to vary with the color, so if color is not an object, look for the cheapest one.

Reviews.Title: Simple to use... as long as your hands fit it properly
Reviews.Author: J. E. Romeo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my wife, and I am glad I bought it for her and not myself.  This is an entry level camera and nothing more.  The picture quality is good, certainly not spectacular, but it is perfectly acceptable for 4x6 prints and online viewing.The ergonomics of this camera however drive me absolutely crazy.  I don't know who at Canon came up with this button layout scheme... but they should be demoted, if not fired.  You much have long SKINNY hands to use this camera comfortable.  Otherwise it is uncomfortable and awkward to hold, whether you have chubby or just short fingers.  This is mostly due to the poorly places Mode dial which overhangs the right side of the camera, so it either gets hit by your palm, of just forces you to hold the camera in an awkward position which does nothing for holding the camera steady.If you do manage to get a picture, and not a blurry mess, then what you get as I said is respectable.  There is a bit of purple fringing in high contrast pictures, but lets be honest for a second, if you are purchasing an basic point and shoot like this, you are probably almost certainly not going to notice the fringing.If you just need something small to occasionally get a quick snap, then this entry level device may work for you.  For anybody looking for a bit more... look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Phenominal Quality for the Price
Reviews.Author: Robert Speakman
Reviews.Content: We were looking to replace a very old digital camera and we didn't want to pay too much.  We also didn't want a camera that we had to replace in a few years.After reading the reviews we ordered this camera.  Boy, are we glad we did!The most important thing for us was getting a camera that did well in low lighting settings.  Our house has some darker backgrounds (dark furniture, some paneling, etc.) which tended to make our pictures grainy on our old camera.Not with this one!  Even from across the room the pictures turned out crisp and clear.  Every picture is so clean and clear. We're going to take more pictures now JUST because of this camera!If you're wanting a camera that is easy to use and takes great pictures... AND is priced very well... look no further! :)

Reviews.Title: Professional results, low cost, easy to use
Reviews.Author: J. Newell
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth digital camera in about 5 years. Each time we buy one the features are greatly expanded and the ease of use increases dramatically. We still have 2 of the other cameras and will continue to use them. However the Canon A 3100 IS will be the one that we carry with use for spur of the moment shots, the lite weight, ease of use, quality of photos, and low cost are the main reasons.For the cost you can't do better.

Reviews.Title: This camera is great
Reviews.Author: C. RICE "Mom 2 four"
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures with great color to them. Very easy to use and even takes good pictures in the dark. So far there isn't anything I don't like about this camera, after all it is a Cannon and they are known for their cameras.Pros:Takes great pictures.Small enough to put in pocket or purse.Has enough options to take all kinds of pictures.Good battery life.Large viewing screen.Very attractive (I have the red)Cons:I can't think of any yet.I would recommend this camera to ant one that wants a small point-&-shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Was great until it died....
Reviews.Author: MammaMia
Reviews.Content: I really liked this camera until it died. I got a "lens error" message a year and a month after I bought it. What a waste. We took good care of it and are very disappointed in the fact that it only lasted a year. The error message seems to be a common issue with Canon, but of course I don't know that until after it dies.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic photos!
Reviews.Author: fotofanatic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a gift for Christmas.  I enjoy photography and had an idea of what I was looking for.  My nephew was so excited when he opened it and started snapping photos!I can't speak for the video feature (although my little Canon is great for videos), but the photo quality, LCD size, settings and total size are great!  I like the 4x Optical zoom with Image Stabilization (very important in my opinion!) because it's a good zoom without blur.  An important feature I had some trouble finding on similar sized/valued cameras was the battery type.  I like the Lithium rechargeables because they last a long time and you don't have to keep buying new batteries when the batteries run down.  I only wish it had a view finder, but most don't these days and my nephew wouldn't use it anyway!Canon brand is a great brand in my opinion, too.  I currently have a 50D DSLR, but had the XTi before that.  My printer is a Canon as well as my small camera (I keep in my purse) and my video camera.  Never had any problems with any of them!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera!
Reviews.Author: Mommy2JackTooty
Reviews.Content: This camera is great! Before purchasing this camera, I had gotten a Fuji Film FinePix z70 and couldnt' stand it.  I returned it after a week because I couldn't get it to take a good picture.  Every picture was out of focus or the camera would choose to focus on the dust in the air.  I was miserable with it.  I was worried that I wouldn't be able to find a camera that I really liked, but I decided to take a chance on this camera - and I'm in love.  This camera is so easy to use that I haven't even read the manual for it.  The battery is keeping a charge nicely and it charged fairly quickly, too.  I'm really happy with the quality of the photos this camera takes.  I have a 16 month old son, who just can't sit still so I need a camera that can keep up with him and this is that camera!  Believe me, I did a lot of research after returning the Fuji Film camera and before buying this one - I'm pretty sure there is no better camera out there for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: JimG
Reviews.Content: The Canon A3100IS digital camera provides great digital photographs at a very reasonable price. The fully automatic nature of the camera is perfect for my wife who is not a knowledgeable photographer and does not want to become a knowledgeable photographer. She just wants to take a photo once in a while and share it with family. This camera is slightly bigger than the SD1400IS elf camera (a little wider), but I still consider it an elf camera. Both camera models fit in the same model number of case. Some performance aspect is normally sacrificed in order to achieve a very competitive price for the A3100IS. For many people, including my wife, this is not a problem, the A3100IS meets her requirements.

Reviews.Title: This little camera takes some really good photos.
Reviews.Author: John P. Salmons
Reviews.Content: got this for my daughter.  She takes lots of photos.  This camera does a really nice job of taking excellent photos and, at the end of the day, that is what it is for.  It's compact, the battery seems to last a long time and it takes great pictures.  I've not used it so I can't speak to the bells and whistles and its performance in low light etc but my daughter is happy with it for what she likes to take.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Stephanie R. Fowler "Srforests"
Reviews.Content: I'm no photographer - but I enjoy taking pictures of things. I bought this camera to take photos of the jewelry I make so it could be posted and sold online. I really wasn't expecting much. I'm absolutely amazed at the amount of detail this camera can capture, and how clear my jewelry photo look. I find myself taking photos of anything and everything I come across. The 4X optical zoom is wonderful, and even though you lose focus when you zoom digitally, the pictures still come out clear enough that you can tell what you were photographing. Not so with my old crappy cheapo digital camera.If you're looking for a good quality camera that has all the basic functions you need to take great pictures without too much programming, this is definitely the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: not what i was looking for
Reviews.Author: J~
Reviews.Content: I have a very old EasyShare DX6490 Zoom and a point and shoot Fuji that I got at work for free. I was looking for something in the middle-something small w/ good photo quality and quick shutter speed. Consumer reports rated this camera as good and Canon has a good name so I decided to buy.I used the camera inside and outside and was not impressed with the inside photos. I took photos of my husband, the dog, books on the book shelf and so on. They quality wasn't the best and not what I was looking for. I was afraid to use it for the baby photos of our soon to be born baby so I returned it to amazon for a refund and settled with using the old EasyShare in the hospital and for all the rest of the baby photos.Now that the baby is older and moving, I decided that the shutter speed wasn't good enough on my EasyShare (which is a bummer because the photo quality is still great) so I decided to splurge and am ordering a Nikon D5000. Even though it's a monster, the photo quality will be great.I'm really glad I returned the camera-it was my first return to Amazon. I know I wouldn't have been happy with it for those precious moments I wanted to remember even though it's a light point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: PowerShot A3100IS is a category killer!
Reviews.Author: TechWrite "Tech-comm"
Reviews.Content: I gave this camera to my 12 year old grandaugter two months ago. Now she goes everywhere with it and refuses to put it down! It takes well-focused, crystal clear pictures, even in basic point-and-shoot mode. The image stabilization is immensely better than on my Panasonic Lumix TZ5, and its ergonomics and image quality are clearly superior to her mother's recently-purchased Nikon point-and-shoot camera in the same price range. Another thing... the video mode is extremely simple to use and works great. Think I'll sell the Lumix and get one of these for myself!

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Orlando Cerda
Reviews.Content: The product is amazing.  Replaced a 5 year old camera with this one.  It was still working but the quality and bulkyness was getting in the way.  Having a rechargable battery is the main reason I bought this camera and why red?  Because the blue one was 50 dollars more.  Crazy huh?Very good camera and I have been enjoying it a lot.

Reviews.Title: Very cool camera!
Reviews.Author: Brooks
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. Takes great stills, good video and does it with ease. For the price I paid I feel like I got alot of bang for the buck. Very happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Douglas A. Shank
Reviews.Content: This camera is exactly what we were looking for.  We have another camera that is great for outdoor shots that require larger optical zoom levels.  Unfortunately the camera is a little awkward to carry because of its size. The Canon A3100IS is the right size to have handy for birthday parties, picnics, etc.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy O. Menn
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my adult daughter.  She is getting wonderful pictures with it and had it up and running quickly and easily.  A fine camera and a great price.

Reviews.Title: Review of canon powershot A3100IS
Reviews.Author: vishwanath
Reviews.Content: Hi, I have used this product and found it to be very good. The photos are of very good quality and the camera itself is quite light and compact enough to carry around. I would like to recommend this product to anybody who is looking for a decent entry level digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy a Cable!
Reviews.Author: Marjorie M.
Reviews.Content: When I ordered this camera, there was no "What's in the box".  Listed under "Frequently Bought Together" was Canon USB Cable IFC-400PCU from C4DEALZ. I thought that meant it didn't come with its own USB cable, so I bought that one for a total of $13.97.  DON'T FALL FOR IT! There's a cable in the box.I'm out that money now and stuck with a cable I don't need.  Was this an intentional deception?  No telling.  I just don't want anyone else to be fooled.  I wish Amazon would include a "what's in the box", because I see you still can't tell even from the technical details.

Reviews.Title: What a lemon!
Reviews.Author: Mark S. Mandell
Reviews.Content: I couldn't believe that this camera malfunctioned the minute I got it with this "lens error" message.  I then contacted the Canon tech support who said it wasn't because of the battery(which I had charged fully the day before)or the memory card.  Instead it could've been due to a number of faulty things(lens stuck since it wasn't opening as it should).  I had more luck with the 2.2 megapixel model I bought ten years ago!So instead of sending the camera directly to Canon to have it repaired or replaced, I've opted to return to the vendor and get a refund.

Reviews.Title: Worked good while it lasted
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, after only 1 1/2 years this camera stopped focusing correctly. All regular views and especially zoomed photos are all out of focus although the camera acts like it is focusing. To get it repaired would have cost more than the original price or for a newer, better camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for Price
Reviews.Author: urbanstrawberries
Reviews.Content: This camera is a good buy for the price. I had a nicer canon, but dropped it one too many times, and needed a camera for vacation ASAP. We ordered this and it did awesome. I have wiggly kids (ages 1,5,& 7) and I am also a food blogger, so I was looking for a few things. I needed image stabilizer for the kids and a good macro/zoom for taking pictures of food. This seems to do nicely so far. It is light weight, and pocket size. I was worried about battery life, but found that it lasts long enough for one long event (4-5 days) or quite a few food photo shoots. If you are going on vacation where you won't be able to charge it (like camping for a week or longer) then I'd recommend getting an extra battery.

Reviews.Title: The thrill is back!
Reviews.Author: B. McEwan "yellokat"
Reviews.Content: I'm a former professional photographer who long ago gave up taking pictures because it was just too much hassle. Lugging all my gear around got to be such a chore I *never* took pictures for fun. The thrill was gone. I tried using small point and shoot cameras but the picture quality of the models I could afford was so poor that I was embarrassed to show anyone my shots. Then someone told me about the latest Canon models and I decided I'd check them out. I am stunned at the beautiful photos I can take with the 3100!I love this camera for many reasons. First, it is truly effortless to take great pictures with this little gem. And unlike some digitals I've had in the past, this one interfaces seamlessly with iPhoto on my Mac. I just plug it in and have my pictures uploaded in seconds - literally. I never even had to load Canon's software, although I think that is due to the Mac more than to the camera. The camera is small and light, but not so small that it's hard to use. The buttons are easy to reach and clearly marked. I just slip the 3100 into my pocket and go. It's a delight not to feel weighed down.Others have discussed the features in depth, so I will not go into those here. Suffice to say that this little camera has enough bells and whistles to encourage one's creativity. And the price is very good. I can't quite believe that I got a camera with this many features, including a 4x optical zoom and 12 megapixels, for such a modest price.While it is certainly true that someone with a high-end Canon or Nikon digital SLR can take better pictures than I can with the 3100, I challenge anyone to take better shots with another camera of comparable price. The Canon 3100 has put the fun back in photography for me and I highly recommend it to anyone who is interested in taking pictures simply for the joy of it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: Keverne
Reviews.Content: I need a camera to take photos for my website so the zoom and anti-shake abilities are really, really important.  This camera does it.  I am so impressed by the quality of this camera for the price.  Plus it's small enough but not too small and is easy to operate - I didn't really need to read much to get it going.  It's also compatible with Windows which is helpful for me and my use.

Reviews.Title: Good for beginners. Others will want more camera.
Reviews.Author: Caramalizer
Reviews.Content: Canon's Powershot 'A' series targets beginners with value offerings. The A3100 is at the higher end of the line featuring image stabilization and a slim rechargeable battery that allows for a compact body.It's features are pretty much what the more expensive SD series offered 2 years ago. However, their metal heft and feel are absent. I'm not sure how this affects durability, but the buttons are definitely less satisfying to press. Fortunately the lighter weight and slightly upturned grip make the A3100 easier to hold than the latest SD and Elph series which--for better or worse--have reverted to the soap bar shapes of old.SMART AUTO (only red icon on the mode dial) is the prescribed shooting mode for basic users, and makes 'point-and-shoot' as fool-proof as possible. Another convenience is the dedicated PLAY button to review pictures or movies taken (PLAY used to be on the mode dial on older Canon compacts). Face detection--which tries to make sure people instead of the background are in focus--is built in. This includes its implementation as a self timer option that takes a picture 2 seconds after a new face (i.e. your own) enters the scene. By default, useful screen prompts are displayed at every stage of operation to guide new users. These can be turned off.While SMART AUTO lets you focus on taking pictures, it also denies you virtually all control. For photographers who want to keep things simple, this is a good thing, but I'm disappointed that in this mode you have to give up the nice widescreen 16:9 aspect ratio, and the ability to select a smaller image size--you must shoot at the full 12 megapixels. The latter means many users of this camera will likely be emailing you huge images that are 5MB+ each. Zooming felt sluggish and was compounded by my struggle with the thumb-operated zoom control located on the back of the camera. I'm used to a toggle on the front of the camera operated by my index finger.People who just want to point and shoot will appreciate this camera. Photographers who want a bit more control have at their disposal many of the standard features we have come to expect: scenes, artistic effects, movie mode, ISO/exposure compensation, force flash off, image size, etc. The A3100 boasts many capabilities, but compared to other cameras costing even $50 more, the compromised handling makes it hard to get the most out of this camera, and a budding amateur may well grow weary of its limitations.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Kara L. Hamilton "Bou"
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera my mother could figure out. This super simple point and shoot has been great for her. I highly recommend it to the technology disadvantaged beginner.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!
Reviews.Author: lzuniga
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a gift for a relative. The camera is very nice and its size and weight are ideal to carry with you all the time.

Reviews.Title: Good camera at great price
Reviews.Author: Neve R Panic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have gone through 3, this being our third one, cameras in less than 4 years.  Mind you we take excellent care of our cameras, but still with no warning...BAM...they just stopped working.  We had always been faithful to Samsung because we loved our very first "real" digital camera which was a Samsung.  However after two failures we decided to abandon ship and try a brand with more Camera  behind its name.  After shopping around I found this Canon Powershot at a very good price.  So far so good.  Easy to use...not quite as easy as our Samsungs, great picture quality and all the features and specs we were looking for.  I have had some trouble taking video in low light...very grainy!!  The only other thing that I am not super happy about is the flash sensitivity in easy mode.  There are times where it seems like there would be no need for flash and yet POOF.....which we all know can create a lot of flash back and consequently a poorer quality shot.Overall I am very pleased. It has a quick focus/shutter speed which has made for some great action shots...it's a bit slow between pics, but not much more than most.  For the price I got at Amazon for this camera...I can't complain.  If you have the money...buy a more expensive, more professional type camera (like SLR) to avoid those little annoying quirks.  If you are like me and riding a shoestring budget...shop Amazon for Canon and you will be satisfied overall.

Reviews.Title: great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: kim
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures!  We bought it for our 5 1/2 year old daughter (she is able to operate it easily), but since that time, our digital SLR camera has been in the shop for repairs so we've been using it quite a bit.  It is a little slow between pictures, but the image quality is good.  We have had it about a month and are happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: PR
Reviews.Content: The camera is slim, easy to carry around, turns on quickly, takes a lot of pictures from one battery charge, has a lot of options and takes a good picture.  My only complaint is that when I viewed the pictures at their full size (4000x3000) the image was slightly blocky.  Viewing the pictures at a "normal size" (1600x1400) the picture looked perfectly fine.  Considering it is a point and shoot camera, it isn't supposed to have amazing SLR quality at that size.  Besides that minor issue, it is a great point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for kids
Reviews.Author: Happy Trails
Reviews.Content: Bought these for kids under 10 for their first real cameras.  Easy to use, works great, and takes quality pictures.  Couldn't ask for a better first camera for young kids.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for kids
Reviews.Author: Happy Trails
Reviews.Content: Bought these for kids under 10 for their first real cameras.  Easy to use, works great, and takes quality pictures.  Couldn't ask for a better first camera for young kids.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Curley
Reviews.Content: As always, Canon has made another great little camera for the average user. It was a Christmas gift for a 14 year old boy. It took him only a few minutes to figure out how to take great photos and a few minutes more to discover video capabilities. I had to buy a larger SD to store all his videos and photos. Best camera ever!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, especially for the price!
Reviews.Author: FaceofFriendship
Reviews.Content: This really has been a great surprise. Excellent camera, takes GREAT pics and is more than adequate for our needs. In fact, we are most pleased with the excellent quality of the pictures. Shutter speed is faster than we expected.We really could not be more pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect camera to use for the memorable occations!!
Reviews.Author: Jennica
Reviews.Content: I have panasasonic camcorder but it's pictures are not clear. So I read reviews and I chose this camera and I was pleasantly surprised. It is very easy to use and great picture quality. I took it to my X-mas gathering at my daughter's get away home in Hudson Valley and it took beautiful pictures. It is small and inexpensive, I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Pretty Camera
Reviews.Author: Marhelena
Reviews.Content: Compact, pretty camera. It takes very good photos. I am satisfied with the cameraCanon PowerShot A3100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 4x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Red) and with Amazon's service. The attention was excellent and the purchase was delivered in the promised space.

Reviews.Title: Best choice for my 1st camera!!
Reviews.Author: eternalmena
Reviews.Content: This was the first digital camera that I have ever purchased. I did alot of research into it, between reading consumer reports, and customer reviews. For the price range I was looking at this camera was the best overall I came across!! Once I received it I immediately started using it and I haven't put it down since!!..It is soooo easy to use and the picture quality is great!!..I have only used it on the automatic setting and have been so pleased with every picture Ive taken that I havent even tried any of the others yet!!...I love this camera and would definitely recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: The A3100 es good
Reviews.Author: Randolph Vargas Balbuena
Reviews.Content: This Camera es very good.  Very small and is good for manipulate it.  The pictures are good.  Some times it take it's time between picture to take another picture, but the good thing is the quality.

Reviews.Title: Great first camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Turcany
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my eight-year-old daughter to replace a low-res, boring, plastic "Barbie" toy camera that produced color smears instead of actual pictures. She is absolutely thrilled with her new "real" camera. The modest additional cost to upgrade from a "toy" to the real thing was definitely worth it. She's learning how to explore all of the functions, and it also has an "Easy" setting for her first attempts. The picture quality is amazing considering the cost of the camera. We are totally, totally satisfied with this purchase. Thank you, Canon!

Reviews.Title: this camera is awesome
Reviews.Author: Sarah Lazarus
Reviews.Content: I like this camera. I'm not a camera expert, I'm just a lay-woman regarding such things, but in that context, I like it a lot. It takes good pictures and it takes them pretty fast. The end.

Reviews.Title: Granddaughter's Christmas present
Reviews.Author: bestgram3
Reviews.Content: We haven't printed any photos but the photos on the screen are disappointing to me.  They are not crisp or bright. Maybe there is something wrong with the camera...or I need to read the instructions...  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Its the Software
Reviews.Author: Douglas Tachi "Lark"
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures. The software handling the computer interface is not user friendly and compared to the HP/Kodak system leaves much to be desired. Systems engineers need to filter their products through a consumer use advisor who can change the language to simple and intuitive terms like "download pictures" or "email pictures".

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera & delivery
Reviews.Author: Norita Blood
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for both the new camera user and long-time camera users. Easy to use.  The delivery system from Quality Photo was prompt, arriving in excellent condition due to super packing, with a follow-up from the company to check on how the camera arrived. This was a Christmas gift, and the recipient is very pleased with the product.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Cliff
Reviews.Content: Great pictures.  Low light and indoor pictures are great as well.  Nice videos also.  Excellent camera for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Purchase
Reviews.Author: Jenny P "Jenny"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my boyfriend because he used my Canon Powershot A560 on a number of occasions.  This camera is great!  Simple instructions, easy to use and great picture quality.  I stand by Canon products 100%!

Reviews.Title: Best Little Camera I've had
Reviews.Author: Shelley R. Morse "srmorse"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful pictures inside and outside. Easy to use, easy to move, easy to save pictures, and easy to carry. Very happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Simple functionality
Reviews.Author: dereklm12880
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, it's great for simple functionality of use, easy to set settings without any trouble of going through menus.

Reviews.Title: Love my new camera!
Reviews.Author: books-a-bazillion "books-a-bazillion"
Reviews.Content: This a great little point-and-shoot camera.  Compact, lightweight, and easy to use.  Picture quality is excellent.  I tried some cheaper point-and-shoot cameras and they felt flimsy and plastic.  This feels like it won't break the first week you own it.  Shutter speed is a tiny bit slow, but still better than my old camera.  I recommend this camera if you want a decent one for a small price.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for its price
Reviews.Author: S. Vogt
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a nice, simple, compact point and shoot that took great pictures but doesn't cost and arm and a leg. This camera is excellent. It takes decent photos in all lighting conditions, and is very simplistic in its operation. The shutter speed is ok, too. Maybe not as fast as some but better than some Canons I have used before. If you just want a basic, competent point-and-shoot and don't need HD video or any or the advanced features - this is a must-buy and a good value.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, great pictures
Reviews.Author: C. Stahl "Free Indeed (John 8:36)"
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to use, rechargeable! and produces great pictures and videos! As another reviewer has stated, the high pixel resolution even lets you use the digital zoom without sacrificing too much picture quality.A great product. After five years our Canon PowerShot SD 1000 broke and this model is an excellent replacement for it. The SD 1000 had a very solid feel to it because its case was all metal, whereas this model's case is plastic, which makes it a lot lighter.The picture quality is so much better! Reviews.Title: great cannon powershot 12.1 mp digital camera

Reviews.Content: works really welll. very crisp and clear pictures. even when i zoom, the pictures say nice anc clear

Reviews.Title: I used to be a photographer
Reviews.Author: hombre viejo
Reviews.Content: You know, darkroom, dodging prints, all that. I have five good to excellent film cameras. I never thought I'd descend to using a point-and-shoot, but film is all but dead and the darkroom has gone dark. So now I have this electronic toy. And damned if it doesn't take good pictures, pretty much all by itself! If you have to be dragged into the 21st Century, you might as well go with this well-made, tiny, good-at-taking pictures Canon.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot A3100IS
Reviews.Author: T. Johnson
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace a broken Canon camera that had a lot more features.  I never used the extra features, so I decided to get a small point and shoot.  I took pictures all through Christmas, and almost all of them turned out great.  Only a couple were fuzzy and that is because of movement.  I haven't tried the video yet.  The battery seems to keep a charge for a long time.  So far, I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Author: sydney
Reviews.Content: It's a great first camera for my young son.  He likes it.  The picture quality is good and it is simple to use.

Reviews.Title: broken

Reviews.Author: S. Lewis
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for less than a year.  I loved it for the first six months, then it started having issues.  About a month ago, it started shutting itself off and stating there was an E32.  Turns out I have to return the camera to the company for repair.  I think a camera should last more than a few months before it has problems.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture Quality, Great Features, Great Price
Reviews.Author: T&T;
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 10-year-old just because the price is good. Unlike most low end digital cameras, this A3100IS has a real Optical Image Stabilizer. It does not use AA batteries, which IMHO is a good thing. It makes the camera small and stylish. And it improves the flash charge time too. It has a set of shooting modes ranging from dumbest Simple mode with no user option to Auto mode with limited user options to P mode with lots of user options. It also has many scene modes to fit your needs.I did not expect much on image quality from this cheap camera. As I also bought myself a new point-n-shoot camera, which is 5x more expensive, I did some test shots and expected my bigger camera blew this A3100IS away. But I was wrong!Under good light conditions, A3100IS's image quality is surprisingly good. The color is vivid and the image is sharp. While my more expensive camera can produce corner-to-corner sharpness, A3100IS's center area is actually sharper! It has some Barrel Distortion and Purple Fringing. But they are not serious at all. Most likely, you will not even notice them.It is a little weird that your finger has to cross the mode dial to push the shutter button. But it should not be a problem if someone uses this camera exclusively. The build quality is a little questionable. The camera body was not aligned perfectly like those more expensive ones. I found a dirty spot on lens when I first turned it on. (From the packaging, I am sure it is brand new and not a customer return.) A piece of Canon lens tissue took care of it in no time. But then, I found a dust inside the LCD screen. Well, what can you expect from this sub $100 camera?Overall, I gave it solid 5 stars because of its exceptional image quality and great price.

Reviews.Title: really good, inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: E. Rubio
Reviews.Content: a bit hard to figure out all the features, but a little patience to read the user's manual is all that's neededhighly recommended

Reviews.Title: Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Bought camera for trip to Costa Rica and it was absolutely the best camera I've used on a trip. Never had any problems with the camera, but would highly suggest purchasing a memory card with a speed of at least 8. It's great to have so you can take faster pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Gary Phipps
Reviews.Content: This camera is perfect for me.  Simple, inexpensive, great photos.  I have used it a lot and it is still in perfect condition.  Very durable.  I used it in my art business so it has proven to be very useful to me and is often used.  Recharging is fast and very simple.  Have no complaints about it at all.

Reviews.Title: Light and Durable
Reviews.Author: M. Russell
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera.  Perfect for first time digital camera users.  Still better quality photos than those taken from a cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Takes great pictures
Reviews.Author: Lynn High
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for quite awhile now & I still love it! It is easy to use & still ALWAYS takes great pictures! It has been fun to use!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A3100S Point & Shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Anilao diver
Reviews.Content: I gave this Canon pocket camera to my wife, and she has used it on several trips to the desert and to other continets.  It is tough, easy to use, compact, takes great photos and the battery life is quite good.  She is very happy with it.  For point& shoot there are several excellent makes of camera, but Canon seems to me to be the best buy.  The only problem is obsolescence, all digital cameras become obsolete in a short time and it is impossible to get them repaired.  Fortunatley this little Canon is a survivor and still works perfectly.  Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: Dead Pixels
Reviews.Author: Angel
Reviews.Content: I really do like this camera! But I had to replace it THREE times when I purchased it (all done quickly and easily). Each time the screen showed dead pixels (they show up as white squares) and they were not just on the screen, but on the final print out of the photo as well. This last one I exchanged has finally given up (a year later) now has many dead pixels which are showing up on final printed product. Very sad! But this camera is VERY easy to use, small, light-weight and super simple and fun to take along on holidays! it's not super quick, but is great for play or when you don't want to carry around a larger camera. Just don't let your warranty run out (mine is and I didn't buy extended!) because this is the most I've ever used any camera warranty!!

Reviews.Author: Chavans

The colors tend not to be as vivid as with my other Canons, but I usually use computer software to adjust, resize and crop my photos, so that is no big deal.  I am able to end up with what I want.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!

Reviews.Content: I am surprised at the quality of pictures from this simple, aim and shoot camera.  I use this camera when a larger one is to bulky to carry like on hikes or on trips.

Reviews.Content: I love my CANON POWER SHOT A3100..it is so easy to use...fits nice in hand...high quality pics...image stabilizer...very forgiving!!  I guarantee you will not be disappointed!! BUY & enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A3100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: dilightful
Reviews.Content: For a small digital camera to easily carry on vacation, etc, very good for the price.  Takes pictures almost as good as my $400 camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: denver don
Reviews.Content: I have not used the camera much since purchase but can agree that the delay time between pix is as noted previously... you can't be a trigger slammer.Will follow up more when I get prints etc. but my sis sez the shots are great.This is a followup to my A590IS (8 mp 4x zoom) so it's an improvement and what's also great - no batteries.  The charger/camera is alot lighter to tote around.I loved the good photos that I got with the A590IS so I expect to love even more this newer edition.

Reviews.Title: SLOW, SLOW, SLOW
Reviews.Author: Toni Bautista "Tonis"
Reviews.Content: Yes, it takes great pictures if kids are not moving around, even slightly. It takes great pictures if your outside or it's not to dark in the AUTO setting. It is EASY to use. If this is a gift for a kid who is btwn 7-18 years old, then it is okay for the money ($166). However, it is SUPER SLOW to take the next picture. If this is for an adult who has babies, toddlers or young children...it'd be best you spend the money on a better camera. I'm not a photographer so I just care about the easy settings and to point and shoot, but now I wished I would have coughed up another $200 for a better compact camera. The problem is that the higher MP, the more space in my computer and external hard-drive they take up. Keeping it from 8-12 mp, seems reasonable, but there isn't anything out there that's reasonably priced. The newer digital cameras are coming out with 16MP. That's too much for me. Consumer reports has the Canon PowerShot S95 as one of the top 3 digital cameras with 10mp and from the amazon reviews, it looks like most are happy with it. I just can't see myself paying $381.00!!!  For now I am stuck with this camera, bc it's what I can afford.NOTE: It seems as soon as consumer reports says "X" is a great camera, people buy, stock is depleted, prices go up and then a new batch of the same model is made, but that newer batch doesn't do as well technically as the first batch. How else could you explain the newest reviews to be so unhappy?
