Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: postman
Reviews.Content: I actually owned this camera for almost a year now, bought it from my local retailer for $99 sale price back in march 2011. I have a sandisk 8gb memory card that i had to buy seperately. This is my first camara and its not that bad. Of course there are better ones out there but obviously they cost WAY more. For the money i paid i like it.It has a rechargeable battery that comes with it. The memory card slot is in the same location as the battery.The picture quality is really good but the video is standard definition. It was fairly easy to use but then again i am tech savvy. Someone thats not that familiar with technolgy might have a hard time figuring things out. The screen on back is nice a large so you can see everything well. Built in mic, and you can play back videos that you record. Video length depends on memory card size of course. It comes with a usb cable as well as a/v cables that you can hook to your tv.The camera is well made (i droppped it a couple times and it still works fine) and when you shut it off the lens covers it self.Overall I would recommend this to someone who is looking for a cheap everyday camera.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!
Reviews.Author: Lena "Lena"
Reviews.Content: My old camera died on me and I wanted a replacement that wouldn't break the bank. For the price, this camera is great. Not the best thing in the world, but definitely takes great pics (i usually fix saturation/brightness on the computer). The settings are a little funny sometimes and the flash is a little too bright in certain settings but I am happy.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Judy C. Goodaker
Reviews.Content: This camera takes wonderful pictures.  It is a convenient size to carry for snapshots.  After all of the reviews decided to purchase this one to replace a Fujifilm camera and have not been disappointed.

Reviews.Title: best for price
Reviews.Author: Abuelito Patricio
Reviews.Content: The Canon Powershot A3100 is the best camera for the price I know. In fact its features like the dial on top make for easy changes in the options. I have used this camera for more than a year, and I have given one to each of my kids as well. The quality of images outperforms more recent Canon cameras in this series and the elph line.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Felicia A Woodward
Reviews.Content: I love the canon powershot line - great cameras. The auto features are nice, but I really like that you can choose the settings yourself.

Reviews.Title: Worth it!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on March (half a year ago) and I love it! The images are awesome thanks to the image stabilizer. I almost have to do nothing with my pictures except editing the light a little bit. The images are always clear and beautiful. But just one thing, I spent only a little bit over $100 on this camera (I got a brand new one) on March, perhaps it was on sale. So if you are debating yourself about the price, wait until spring or thanksgiving. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot A3100IS
Reviews.Author: Timothy W. Marcoulier
Reviews.Content: This Canon Power Shot is easy to use.  It downloads to the laptop very easy and puts pics where you can find them.Small, compact, and lightweight, it is a winner.  High Recommendation.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: seekingamy
Reviews.Content: i love this camera! It is so easy to use and takes great quality pictures! I would recommend it to anyone! :)

Reviews.Title: Solid Canon A3100 Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: mtprofessor43
Reviews.Content: I have owned my Canon PowerShot SX120 IS camera for two years, and sold it because the AA batteries drained quickly, and the battery door was difficult to open. I am totally satisfied to own my new Canon A3100 camera. I like pressing halfway lightly until the camera beeps twice and AF frames appear where the camera focused well. I tested some photos, they are crisp, and clear with good colors. The flash works well indoor perfectly. The advantage of using this camera has a good battery door to open much easier than SX120 IS. This 4 GB SDHC memory card has 1,231 shots with 12 MP. A good battery lasts longer. The battery can be fully charged in an half hour quickly. No more AA batteries to purchase. I highly recommend this product to everyone. If you want a small camera to carry easily to somewhere, then this is for you.

Reviews.Title: great for this beginner
Reviews.Author: Oh Brother
Reviews.Content: I've taken pictures before, but usually on other people's cameras when they wanted someone else to take a picture of them. I'm not a photographer at all. I do love post-processing, though, and so I decided that I should probably learn how to shoot pictures. After a lot of research into point-and-shoot models under $300, I decided on this one, and I'm not sorry. The pictures are crisp with good colors. The auto setting works well, and there are manual settings for ISO and white balance. The macro setting works beautifully. Turning the knob activates settings like kids/pets (fast shutter speed) and portrait (shorter depth of field? I'm not sure). I haven't tried to shoot video, but that's the last mode on the knob. There is also a setting on the knob for ultra-beginners or for children that "locks out" most buttons and shoots on full auto.The flash isn't very strong, but that's what I'd expect from a little camera like this. Obviously no viewfinder, which is not a problem for me. The LCD screen has adjustable brightness settings and seems durable enough.Transfer of photos is via USB, and the camera acts like a drive. No problems on my older Vista machine. I didn't install any software for the camera except maybe a driver that installed automatically.My 8 y/o dropped the camera from about two feet and it didn't seem to take any damage. I doubt it is super durable but normal use with kids doesn't seem to hurt it.Overall, I strongly recommend this camera. No problems so far.

Reviews.Title: Fine "Instamatic" Digital Camera for Ordinary Use
Reviews.Author: Jonathan B. Hall
Reviews.Content: This is a good take-with camera for parties, get-togethers, family occasions. It's limited in terms of features---there's a "kids and pets" setting, for instance (is that supposed to be "shutter priority," I wonder?)---not a serious camera, but fun and user-friendly. The only drawbacks I'd note are a fixed screen (I'm used to a swiveling one), and a slow cycle time.Other than that, great value for the money, small and portable, easy to figure out, and in short, the modern version of the old Kodak Instamatic---with twelve megapixels! Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!!
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Lee
Reviews.Content: I originally owned a Canon Powershot A590IS, which after years of use, developed a problem that was unrepairable.  I looked at this camera to replace the 590, as it is advertised as the newer replacement model of the same camera.  I love the size and the weight, I love the Canon features, although the placement of the power on/off and the shutter buttons are less user friendly than my 590.  The camera takes pictures that are of professional quality and has enough options for taking pictures that allow someone like me, who knows just a little about cameras, to take different sorts of pictures, without having to be an expert.  It also allows me to go in to totally automatic or easy mode, so that the camera will do all the work.  Overall, a great camera and a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Had to buy a second one.
Reviews.Author: Francis M. Denver
Reviews.Content: I purchased  the Canon A3100IS, (Blue), about a year ago. It's self focusing lense 4X Optical Zoom, Image Stabilizer, helps me take pictures of Manufacturers Tags on clothing items, I place on eBay. The close up is so clear, you can read the tags.I took it to the beach recently and somehow lost it. I immediately purchased another one A3100IS,(Silver), to continue my photos of eBay items as well as my grandkids. It's a great little camera !

Reviews.Title: New Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Thien "jollyelf"
Reviews.Content: So far I am very pleased with the quality of pictures and ease of using this camera.  Can't beat a Canon for quality photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Ashok
Reviews.Content: Wow. Great camera.  Great picture for this great price.  Cam is slim and portable.  Picture quality is really equivalent to professional DSLR camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: Exceptionally clear pics, excellent detail, and - fairly - easy to use and is a convenient size!!! We love the high MP's (12.0 to be precise) and higher optical zoom than many other models (though I wish it was even bigger -- on it's zoom abilities) 4x Optical Zoom. I like taking pictures of mountains, sky and clouds, my family, and old architecture! It does great on landscape shots, sunrises and sunsets!!! I'd definitely recommend Cannon. This is our 2nd Canon brand digital camera. I do not feel that we have learned even most of the capabilities of this camera yet (helps if you read the instruction manual), but know I will be even more impressed when I get more into the picture enhancement features it has as well!!!!!!! Excellent compact model, bought last year! Now you could get one with a bigger zoom for about the same amount of dough (approx. $120-ish). Love this model's Image Stabilization feature (didn't have it or it didn't work as well on our older Canon model).

Reviews.Title: Fine camera that has taken great pictures
Reviews.Author: John H.
Reviews.Content: Finally, updated to digital after decades of 35mm and this digital is working out fine. I have consistently taken fine quality photos just using the "automatic" setting. Fine camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Peggy Perkins
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera and I could not love it more. Small, lightweight, great viewing area, great quality photos, easy download to computer, Love it for sure.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot A3100IS 12.1 MP
Reviews.Author: J. Benson
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this camera. For some reason I have never been able to get good shots in low light situations. Even with my $500.00 Olympus camera. This camera does well in low light and motion shots. The only thing I don't like is the delay in between shots. But for the money, I am very pleased with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera in general.
Reviews.Author: Robert Korsu "radar"
Reviews.Content: If you need an easy to use camera for basic picture taking this is a great camera. For more advaned users the long cycle between shots may be a problem.

Reviews.Title: amazing, fabulous, fantastic camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: suzy
Reviews.Content: i was searching online for a camera. i saw this canon one and it looked very good so i bought it. when i got it, it worked very well.the pictures come out very clear . its a very easy working camera besides when you take a picture you have to hold the botton for at least 3 seconds. but other than that, it is a wonderful camera for all ages!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera, great little price!
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Curley
Reviews.Content: Canon always makes great cameras and this was no exception. I bought it for my 14 year old who was skeptical. Once he tried it, he loved it.It takes terrific still shots and he loves the video mode. I had to buy a larger SD card so he could use it more. Good zoom, fast recycle time andfast shutter speed all help make this a pleasure to use.

Reviews.Title: I'm happy with this camera
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Erwin
Reviews.Content: I had a Canon Powershot A590 and loved it, but the flash stopped working.  So I went to see about another Canon camera and found this one.  I love this camera.  I'm a point & shoot kind of person anyways, so this is perfect.  Some people complain about a lag in between pictures, but I haven't noticed one.  But if that's your biggest complaint, you're probably better off getting a SLR camera, and not a point & shoot like this one.  This is perfect for those candid friends & family moments as well as vacations.  Just my opinion.  Word to the wise, though, don't go for the Free Super Saver Shipping...it took 17 days for this camera to get to me.

Reviews.Title: For $97, perfect..
Reviews.Author: Bruce Oksol "oksol"
Reviews.Content: The price reminds me of those old Brownie cameras or throwaways.But the performance is awesome. Works right out of the box and downloads immediately to Apple computer iPhoto. No need to download software, although it is included just in case one needs it. Comes with cables and rechargeable battery. Battery needs to charged for first time before using.Only a photo flash card is missing but most of us have one or two around the house.Yes, there is a lag time between one photo and taking the next picture. There are sophisticated ways for Canon to get around this lag but that raises the price significantly.

Reviews.Title: Verry Happy
Reviews.Author: Tracy Achilles
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera purely for a trip I was taking, and didn't want to spend too much in case I lost it.Many of the shots were taken from a vehicle going at a fairly fast speed.  I used color and black and white.  Every photo was fantastic.  Very, very impressed.  Bought a spare battery so that I could charge one and have the other.  Took over 1400 pics and lots of video.  Very few were blurred.  Occasionally, the shutter was a little slow for an object, but I would buy another one of these in a heartbeat. V. easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Ordinary guy
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice "little" camera when compared to the Canon PSA95 it's replacing. My daughter always carried the A95 with her, it took great pictures but was clunky with its 4 AA batteries. The A3100 is easy to carry in a pocket or pocketbook. Indoor and outdoor pictures are great and short video clips are easy to download and very entertaining.This canon powershot is not meant to replace the DSLR or HD video cameras my daughter ownsbut to always be available to photograph the grandkids. So far its fulfilled that requirement.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: TP Reitzel
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of Canon's A3100IS are favorable. The successor, the A3300IS, seems to have significant problems so I opted for the A3100IS based on personal and professional reviews. This camera is a good value if a prospective purchaser pays less than $120 as of the date of this review.Let me quote Canon's manual:"The LCD monitor is produced with extremely high-precision manufacturing techniques. More than 99.99% of the pixels operate to specification, but occasionally non-performing pixels may appear as bright or dark dots. This is not a malfunction and has no effect on the recorded image." Unfortunately, I have one of the .01% LCDs which have dead pixels. Words don't compensate for flaws in production, Canon. Regardless, I do agree that the dead pixels on the LCD don't impact the photographic image.Personally, I wanted adequate low-light performance in this camera. * Captured images with ISO 1600 aren't really usable in my opinion and should be avoided. ISO 800 produces a noticeable color shift and loss of detail so it's probably only adequate for low-light, action shots where ISO 400 isn't suitable. ** I have taken a few images of static scenes at night without the flash and constrained to ISO 400 with street lighting and leaning against a support with respectable results. The Canon A3100IS is capable of taking decent low-light shots of static scenes at F3.5 with ISO 400, but a tripod is necessary. For nighttime shots of static scenes without a flash, try F2.7-3.5, ISO 400, and a tripod. For nighttime shots with considerable action ***, naturally use a tripod in a sufficiently bright area due to perimeter lighting or a strong flash, e.g. Canon's HF-DC1, and try F2.7 with ISO 800 only as a last resort. Furthermore, expect noticeable noise, color shift, and loss of detail if you do use ISO 800. The use of a small tripod balanced on one's knee will probably work sufficiently for capturing low-light, action shots (ISO 800) while seated, but I haven't tested the possibility yet. For daytime shots, try F3.5-5.6 and ISO Auto. Physically move closer or further from the scene if necessary. If one doesn't plan to post-process images, try increasing the sharpness in the "Custom Color" setting since the images are a little soft using default settings. For beginning photographers, hold the camera properly, i.e. with the palm of the hand facing toward you with the thumb vertical and 90 degrees to the remaining 4 fingers pointing horizontally. Cup the 4 horizontal fingers at their tips if desired and hold the elbows of both arms next to your body. Place the camera in the area created by the vertical thumb and horizontal fingers. Lastly, to capture colors as accurately as possible, use the option to evaluate white balance judiciously. This camera is capable of producing very good quality images in the "Program" mode and good quality images in the "Auto" mode. If one post-processes the images using non-commercial or commercial software, the A3100IS can produce pictures rivaling those using the hardware processors of cameras twice as expensive. Learn to use post-processing software!If the reader wants very good low-light performance, he will likely have to spend 3x the money and buy a S95. With a bit more experience, I'll likely be satisfied with the A3100IS as I also have Canon's HF-DC1 to use when needed.UPDATE: I've posted a few images in the gallery taken with Canon's A3100IS* All low-light shots use the 2M pixel resolution** Actually, the A3100IS has better performance at ISO 800 than Panasonic's Lumix FH20. However, both cameras are basically unusable at ISO 800 without post-processing of the images. With post-processing software, e.g. the free Wavelet DeNoise plug-in for GIMP, one can produce good quality images even at ISO 800.*** Until P&S; cameras can accurately reproduce images with minimal color shift and noise at ISO 3200, users will need to use a flash when filming dynamic scenes with considerable action at night.

Reviews.Title: Caonon powershot A3100IS
Reviews.Author: G. Kriz
Reviews.Content: I just bought a Canon powershot A3100IS camera, I like the camera, only think I don't care for is the set up for the buttons on top, you have to use the middle button the take the picture, just have to get use to it, my old camera A1000IS, had the picture button on the end.  It is light and takes very good pictures, and well worth it.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the price
Reviews.Author: lj
Reviews.Content: It feels a little less solid than the more expensive cameras, but the guts seems about the same and it works fine.  Seems to be about the best value for the price out there.

Reviews.Title: Great Little basic camera
Reviews.Author: W. Waikel
Reviews.Content: Got this camera for my mom for Christmas. Perfect easy to use basic camera at a great price. She loved it and found it easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for beginner
Reviews.Author: RJ Shopper
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our granddaughter.  It is her first camera and so far has been easy to operate with good quality pictures.  Since it has only been used a few weeks, we cannot give a detailed review at this time.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my mom. It is an upgrade to the one I have (A200IS). She loves it as much as I love mine. The difference is the price. Hers was $100 less than mine on black friday. A great camera for someone who just wants to aim, shoot and have a great picture taken.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Camera was delivered quickly and just as advertised! Would recommend the camera for anyone looking to take great pictures on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Danielle Leblanc "Danielle"
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my mother in law for her birthday.  It's a great camera and easy for her to use.

Reviews.Title: Cannon powershot
Reviews.Author: Mason
Reviews.Content: Great camera for that price range. Very easy to use. Does exactly what I need

Reviews.Title: Very good camera
Reviews.Author: Joel Alejandro Avila Garcia
Reviews.Content: this is my first camera than i buy and it is awesome take very nice pictures , it have many features and it is very easy to use, i recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Very satisfactory!  Very good pictures!
Reviews.Author: R. Brown
Reviews.Content: Worked very well from the start!  many options and choices to make!  Pix have been very good to excellent!!  Very satisfied!!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera.
Reviews.Author: B. Joerres
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price we paid (149).  Boots up fast and take much better pictures than our old camera.  Would buy again!

Reviews.Title: Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Terryl L. Pugh
Reviews.Content: This camera is great!  Easy to use and takes great pictures.  Having a cable to upload directly to my computer is a bonus!  And no more recharging AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: James H. Drury "jameshughdrury-author.com"
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera, price to value to features all figured in and will be used a lot around church events.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Camera!
Reviews.Author: Raine
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my A540 because I wanted better indoor shots.  This camera is horrible!  There is a several seconds delay, so forget any candid shots, and the indoor shots were grainy and dark.  I couldn't get it back to the store fast enough and went back to my reliable A540.

Reviews.Title: Very blurry.
Reviews.Author: kcbk
Reviews.Content: This type of Canon camera does not work as well as my previous one. I am very dissapointed with the pictures it takes. Everything comes out so blurry. The only way I can get it to take any decent pictures at all is to have it on the kids and pets setting. Bummer.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Lewes Martin
Reviews.Content: This camera appears to be good value for the price.  It's not a great camera, but it's small, is easy to operate and takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot
Reviews.Author: graycliff
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  The reason for the 3 star rating was the 4th week I owned it the motor for the lens froze.  Since I was in Vietnam, I had to buy another camera.  I chose to buy another powershot because I like how easy it is to use and for the quality pics.  Hope this was just a fluke.Would also like to mention that I paid for 2 day delivery and got it 6 days later, shipped from Amazon.  I complained to them twice and got no response nor my money back.

Reviews.Title: So, So At Best
Reviews.Author: George S. Hoke Jr. "Fat George"
Reviews.Content: I hate the fact there there is no optical viewfinder. It is nearly impossible in bright light to compose a decent shot using the digital display. This was really apparent yesterday at a Blue Angels air show. This thing takes decent photographs once you get used to it but not that much better than the 3MP Nikon that it replaced.

Reviews.Title: It was GREAT, until it broke.
Reviews.Author: SlingMommy
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera, a first tried it out, it was a TRULY great camera. I used it all the time. It was working great, until about 1 year after I bought it, then one day it just BROKE. BOOM! Like that! It said: "Camera error, restart camera, E32." I kept on trying it, and got the same results. I found out that it fails after exactly 1 minute after taking photos, looking at photos, whatever. I looked it up online and none of the things they said to do did not work, plus, it would cost more to take it to someone to fix the camera, then it would to just replace it. So, like I said, I loved it, 5 stars, until it broke. P.S. I just got this new Coolpix L810 that I think is good for anybody who wants to be a photographer, like I do. Just so you know.

Reviews.Title: Excelente producto
Reviews.Author: Credomatic Cashback "MAKA"
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto muy buen precio excelente tiempo de entrega y enmpaque, realmente es igual al que se aprecia en la imagen.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!!
Reviews.Author: pmelendez
Reviews.Content: I gave up a Canon Coolpix 5700 for this little camera and I love it.  As much as I loved my Coolpix, it was just too outdated for my use and I just couldn't afford a new one.  This little camera does everything that one did and more!  Easy to use and very compact.  Just throw it in your purse or bag and go!!

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: Gaurav Bhatnagar "gauravbt"
Reviews.Content: I always wanted a small camera less than 100 bucks which givs good quality pictures in addition to my bulky SLR.This is a Very good buy and recommended for others.Just remember to keep the AutoSettings in place.always

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Point & Shoot
Reviews.Author: John Rich "Power Tool Junkie"
Reviews.Content: While not as feature rich as my old A571 IS, this little guy gets the job done quite well. Pictures are great, it's easy to use, and best of all, the battery. No more stupid AA's that die at the worst possible times. This battery seems to last forever and I am never worried about picking up the camera for a picture and the battery to be dead.

Reviews.Title: CANON POWERSHOT A3100IS
Reviews.Author: RACHEAL
Reviews.Content: I JUST LOVE THIS CAMERA!IT HAS A VARIETY OF FEATURES AND TAKES BEAUTIFUL PICTURES!I'VE GOTTEN SOMANY COMPLIMENTS ON IT,THROUGH TRIAL AND ERROR I'M FINALLY MASTERING IT,AND THE MANUAL OF COURSE ISVERY HELPFUL.I PURCHASED THE SILVER COLOR,WHICH IS STANDARD,I WISH THEY WOULD HAVE  HAD THE BLUE AVAILABLE WHEN I FIRST ORDERED.ANYWHOSE HIGHLY RECOMMENED,AND THE CARRYING CASE IS A MUST.ALSO THERECHARGEABLE BATTERY IS HOT,SAVES ON REPLACEMENTS.

Reviews.Title: good camera to buy
Reviews.Author: aayush
Reviews.Content: i was lucky enough to fetch this product for [...] bucksit has good shutter speed , with automatic light management and good zoom qualtiy..

Reviews.Title: New Canon
Reviews.Author: Marianne
Reviews.Content: I like my new camera very much. I found it pretty easy to use, although I need to figure out why the shutter speed is slower than I like.

Reviews.Title: SLIM camera, great features for a very reasonable price!
Reviews.Author: David Bickford
Reviews.Content: I love this camera as it fits in the pocket, has a large display screen, uses a rechargeable battery, and is quick to focus and snap the shot.  Very nice quality photos are produced for such a "basic" camera by today's standards, especially for the price!! I highly recommend this camera.  It has a lot of options and helpful features in todays world of digital photography!

Reviews.Title: Nothing great
Reviews.Author: H in TPA
Reviews.Content: The camera is okay...nothing great.  It takes good pics if you have an easy subject...but it takes forever to take a pic.  Not sure I'd buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Sensational and perpetual!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Samuel S. Chan
Reviews.Content: It was really great!!!!!  The one main advantage about this type of camera was that I didn't have to use disposable batteries and constantly put new ones!  All I had to do was charge it up if the battery ever goes dead.  I didn't really use it yet, but I'm very excited to actually start using it when I have the chance;-)

Reviews.Title: NOT a fan of this Canon!
Reviews.Author: juan moran
Reviews.Content: I decided to upgrade my Canon camera and decided on this one.  HUGE mistake.  The different modes option is so close to where you "take" the picture that your finger actual changes the modes/program you're in ALL the time.  In result none of my pictures were coming out clear.  I also wasn't happy with the USB cable door.  To open it was a struggle and made me hate the camera even more.I highly suggest you go with another camera if you want your pictures to come out clear.  Unless you have super small fingers that won't accidentally change the mode you're in, get a different camera!

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Prairie Folk
Reviews.Content: The shutter activation button was way too small and not distinct enough to press without fumbling around. Form following function was certainly not followed here. Otherwise, the camera is of suitable quality.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures but not great feel
Reviews.Author: hemya
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. This is not the expensive model by Canon. It takes great pictures but the handling is not that great. I am a Canon fan and have used Canon Ixus and EOS Rebel SLR before.Pros: The quality of pictures is really good. Face detection works. Inexpensive. Good starting camera with easy to use menu and features.Cons: Cheap feel. Feels like the menu button are made of cheap plastic or fiber.

Reviews.Title: picture quality extremely grainy
Reviews.Author: lizzifer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a Christmas gift for my Mom. I wanted to get her an easy-to-use camera that took good pictures. Based on previous experience, I went with a Cannon. I figured even their "low end" (aka cheaper) models would still take good pictures. I was completely wrong. I tested the camera, and no matter what the lighting scenario and regardless of whether I used the flash, all the pictures were extremely grainy and over-pixelated. Extremely dissappointed. Returned the camera to Amazon immediately.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: janal
Reviews.Content: I haven't used the camera that much but I have found it quite confusing to figure out settings etc.  I don't feel you can call this a point and shoot camera.  The pictures I have taken appear to have come out decent but for the price you can't complain.  It seems to take good pictures, its slow as far as the shutter speed, a little tricky to focus, but again its a Canon and its a good value

Reviews.Title: Easy-Peasy
Reviews.Author: Claire R.H.
Reviews.Content: This little camera is easy to carry, easy to use and the pictures are great. The instruction manual is clear and shows you as well as tells you how to do everything. I use it in my preschool classroom and I've had some great shots.The only negative about this camera is that it does not come with a photo card. I had to go out and purchase one which is silly when ordering a camera by mail. I am sure most people would prefer to pay a few dollars more and be ready to shoot when the camera arrives.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for photos, but try something else for video
Reviews.Author: Al
Reviews.Content: The PowerShot A1300IS has nice stabilized photos, but only 4x optical zoom. You can find up to 8 or 10x optical zoom for 30 or 40 bucks more when they are on deep sales.The video isn't even 720p, so if you're looking to have video, look elsewhere. The only advantage of the old 4:3 video format of 640x480 is that it uses much less memory.

Reviews.Title: Bad picture quality
Reviews.Author: Codyy
Reviews.Content: Very bad picture quality. Even holding the camera with super steady hands the picture comes out blurry. You can see all the little pixels in your pictures. I bought this camera after hearing all the bad reviews of the nikon coolpix cameras and boy was i wrong. My friend just purchased a nikon and it excels better than this canon camera in every way. Only good thing about this camera is its handy and light. But i would avoid buying this camera if your looking for good quality pictures.

Reviews.Title: software will not load
Reviews.Author: S. Martin "Silver Lily"
Reviews.Content: software disc from packaging will not open/run; cannot get images from memory card. canon site does not have software download on their site. will attempt return.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Highwaymom "Amazon advocate"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter in August,her birthday.  She is a techie person and loved it from the get go.  She's not much on taking pictures, however, this little camera has changed that.  She likes the fact that it is small enough to fit in her purse and she's learned to take it everywhere she goes.  The ease and performance are awesome.  Cannon has done it again.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: plastic junk for a draw
Reviews.Author: Alexander Lerner
Reviews.Content: I did all the research... I thought this was going to be a great camera for the money.1st time I took it out the box, I realized it was plastic... felt cheap, but I figured it was a way to keep cost down. So I delt with it. Started to use it, realized the picture quality wasn't that good, and had some serious lag time delay between photos. Well I figured whatever its what you get for $159.00. I started my adventure out for the night and to see how my new camera (Canon 3100 is) . I put my camera in its nice lil "protective" case and put the camera into my front pocket. I'm now at a dinner party and decide to use my brand new camera, maybe even show it off a lil. Then I notice my lcd is cracked. The store which I bought it from said they wouldn't take it back because the screen is crack. And I was confused I had it in the "protective" case. So I sent it to Canon. Where they told me this camera is not as strong as the rebel, and is not durable like cell phones, and can't go in your pocket. Then they wanted $107 to fix it. I will NEVER buy canon again or a plastic camera... I've had many digital cameras that stood the test of time. Canon tried to tell me it was a compression crack (maybe) from my front pocket or that it was put somewhere to hot. Canon, your customer service in Virginia stinks. Don't get fooled that you're getting better service because you speak to someone in the states. I would recommend buying anything else but this camera.

Reviews.Title: I want my old camera back
Reviews.Author: Michellea David "tx2cagirl"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to get this new A3100 IS camera. I wanted the faster flash speed and the 12.1 pix. Now that I have it, I want my old camera back. I had a Cannon A700. The A700 is very slow reset after the picture is taken to get to take the next picture. I wanted a camera that was faster. The A3100 is faster, but not by much. There is still a lag time between pictures. The zoom is not good at all and takes very dark pictures. It takes good pictures only when there is a lot of light. In low light, the pictures are blurry. There are two things I like about this camera. I like the action shots it takes; and I like that it fits in my pocket. I am switching back to my old camera. Not happy with this camera. Can I get my money back??

Reviews.Title: Poor packaging but product was undamaged
Reviews.Author: Jack L. Langdon
Reviews.Content: Very poor packing. Camera was rattling around in a large box with zero packing material to cushion it. However; Canon packaging was very good and the camera seems undamaged and perfect.

Reviews.Title: My old Blackberry takes better pictures
Reviews.Author: jkr66stang
Reviews.Content: I purchased my first point-and-shoot digital camera, a Pentax Optio, 10+ years ago.  So when I went shopping for a new one, I expected lighter weight, better pictures, better menu navigation, etc.  I was astounded to find that this Canon was not much of an upgrade from that old Pentax at all!  At first I thought maybe my expectations were unrealistic, but after spending just $15 more to replace it with a fabulous little Panasonic Lumix FH20, I now know that Canon has come up way short in this price range.The Canon is slow to start up, slow to process a picture and be ready for a second shot, horrid at taking indoor photos, and surprisingly bulky for what it offers.  Compared to the built-in camera on my Blackberry, the Blackberry wins in the quality match up! Pretty unbelievable.The navigation menus and playback took some figuring out, which I wouldn't be mentioning here but now that I have breezed through the Lumix menus without the manual I can see this is another major flaw of the Canon Powershot. It also does not come with a memory card so figure that into the price.One final note... I like a good, sharp, well balanced photo. I have a digital SLR that I love, so this Canon Powershot (now Panasonic Lumix) was intended for every-day toting around.  The Panasonic is an excellent stand-in for my full-on SLR; the Canon isn't worth the weight or bulk in the pocket.

Reviews.Title: Horrible camera
Reviews.Author: Larrie68
Reviews.Content: Pictures keep renumbering, starting at 1. You can't charge it without removing the battery pack.  I didn't realize it didn't take regular batteries when I ordered it.  If you're away from home, forget about buying a couple of AA batteries if it goes dead - you have to have the charger. If you like renaming all your photos, this camera is for you.  I'm going to try and sell it and go back to Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Bait and Switch
Reviews.Author: Pissed
Reviews.Content: This is directed more at Amazon than at Canon. However since there is no where to leave feedback about Amazon unless an order is fulfilled the only place to leave it is at the item site. Amazon offered this camera, (Canon PowerShot A3100IS 12.1 MP Digital Camera), two weeks ago for $99.99, then four days later said that they were unable to ship the item, no reason was given, just that they were unable to ship the camera to me. When I was directed back to the site through the email from Amazon the camera was now $159.99 and I was offered by Amazon to buy the camera at that price! Amazon would not fulfill their original offer for the original price, wouldn't look for the camera elsewhere or take a hit on the price difference in order to have a satisfied customer. Never had any problem before with Amazon, rather disappointed with their customer service. Just FYI, however I am sure I am not the only one that this has happened to. Good luck to all!

Reviews.Title: Worst Canon Ever
Reviews.Author: Len
Reviews.Content: Have had Canon products in the past and they were great but NOT this model.  After ordering the first one the viewing screen became cloudy after 2 weeks.  Returned to Amazon and got another.  Within 1 week the screen went completely blank.  Again Amazon refunded my purchase price.  This camera is obviously not up to Canon's usual standards.  Buy something else.  I finally ended up with a Nikon Coolpix and it is a wonderful camera.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera, but...
Reviews.Author: Liz Kay "Liz Kay"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a birthday gift but was disappointed to find it DID NOT include a memory card... so I immediately had to run out and purchase one. I only wish it had been made clear no memory card was included, but otherwise am satisfied with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Canceled order by Amazon
Reviews.Author: nan ding
Reviews.Content: Recently placed an order of this model of camera when it was advertised $109 at Amazon.com. It took one week for Amazon to notify me that they are back ordered. NOt sure if Amazon is not willing to offer this price anymore. Anyway, it took them additional 3 days to tell me that order is canceled. A lot of hassel to buy another one.It seems Amazon is not the same reliable seller any more.....

Reviews.Title: If you want to read the owner's manual...
Reviews.Author: April Jean "April Jean"
Reviews.Content: I am a mom and bought this camera to take quick quality EASY pictures of my toddlers.  It worked well for a month (super-clear pictures), but now the settings are all funky (the kids pressed some buttons???) and I am left needing to read the owner's manual to figure out how to change all the settings and fix it back.  I just want to be able to switch it to the "kids and pets" setting on the dial and have it automatically correct to where the shutter speed is fast, IS is on and red eye fixes automatically.  I'm sure I could figure out how to do this from the manual, but right now it's on my to do list and I am DREADING this task!! UPDATE: I read the manual...there's not a lot to it.  Switching the setting to AUTO and taking a picture then flipping it back to "kids and pets" seemed to reset everything...however I realized that the blurry/fuzzy pictures are due to a low battery.  I love the way this camera looks, but I just can't say I'm in love with the camera b/c I can't seem to get "professional" looking pictures of faces with it, but that probably has more to do with me than the camera as I am not a professional...who knows.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Amanda N. Moss
Reviews.Content: The camera broke within two weeks! I was very unhappy and had to return it. At least Amazon was quick about the refund.
